grading_system.description: Color-coded placard system with Green (Pass), Yellow (Conditional Pass), and Red (Closed) placards based on major violations and compliance status

Green.criteria: No more than one major violation that is mitigated or corrected during inspection

Yellow.criteria: Two or more major violations, violation of compliance agreement, or same major violation in three consecutive inspections

Red.criteria: Imminent health hazard requiring closure that cannot be mitigated or corrected during inspection

inspection_details.frequency: BCEH conducts 2000+ routine health inspections per year for approximately 1200 retail food facilities
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Yellow placard violations require follow-up inspection within timeframe specified. Red placard requires closure until compliance achieved.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Color-coded placards must be posted at establishment entrance showing most recent inspection status. Inspection reports posted online for public viewing.

fire_safety_authority.department_name: CAL FIRE/Butte County Fire Department - Fire Marshal Bureau
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems must comply with California Fire Code and NFPA standards. Semi-annual inspections required per NFPA 96.
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) for commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems per NFPA 96 requirements

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - Butte County Environmental Health conducts inspections and enforcement
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Butte County Improvement Standards and color-coded placard program requirements beyond state code

confidence_notes: Official Butte County websites provide detailed information on color-coded placard system, inspection processes, and regulatory authority. Fire Marshal information confirmed through CAL FIRE/Butte County Fire Department sources.
verification_notes: All key information verified through official Butte County Environmental Health and Fire Department websites. Color-coded placard system is unique compared to letter grade systems used in other CA counties.
